TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SeriesCollection extends System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElementCollection`1<class System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>
Public Class SeriesCollection Inherits ChartNamedElementCollection(Of Series)

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects, which in turn represent a grouping of related data points and attributes for the series. This collection class is implemented as the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series%2A> collection property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
Series objects can be appended, inserted or removed from the collection at both design time and run time.
When a series is added to the collection, it is automatically assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object named "Default" or, if "Default" does not exist, to the first available chart area in the chart area collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series Add(string name) cil managed
Public Function Add (name As String) As Series

Docs.param: The name of the to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds a object with the given name to the end of the collection.
Docs.returns: The new object appended to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Items are always added as the last item in the collection.
The `name` argument refers to the `Name` property of the object being added.
**Note** If you use this method to add <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> class, the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects of the newly added <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object cannot have more than one Y-value per data point.
